_header: I can be wanton and if I will
_description: I can be wanton — six cross-rhyming quatrains

BodAsh176.First Lines:
I can be wanton & yf I wyllbut yf youe touche me I wyll crye
                    howeI can be merye & thinke no evellbut yet beware one cometh I
                    trowe…
BodAsh176.Last Lines:
…But for all that doe what youe Lyst& I wilbe styll &
                    crye howe no more
BodAsh176.Editions:
Wagner,  B. M. 
             “New Songs of the Reign of Henry VIII.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         50 (1935): 452-55: 452-3.
